awd_titl_txt: Investigation of Non-Equilibrium Epitaxial Growth of        Electronic Materials
awd_abstract_narration: This basic research project utilizes the capabilities unique to                 thermal atomic beam scattering(ABS)--high sensitivity to low                    coverage impurities and defects, real time measurement--to obtain               detailed structural information for complex surface ordered                     phases without surface damage or charging effects allowing the                  study of kinetic, dynamical and structural properties of epitaxy.               The research combines the ABS technique with other advanced                     surface science diagnostic methods to characterize both the                     growth mode, and the structural and chemical details of epitaxial               crystal growth, layer by layer.                                                 %%%                                                                             This research is expected to provide deeper fundamental                         understanding of epitaxial crystal growth at the atomic level.                  From an application point of view, understanding the details of                 crystal growth at this level is particularly helpful to advanced                semiconductor device design and fabrication.  The results will be               of importance in a general way to the technology of large scale,                high speed integrated electronic circuits.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
